result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Defendant to be monitored by drug testing and breathalyzers.

Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court addressed bail at this hearing. Defense requested a scheduling conference. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 03-30-2022, by KATHERINE M. NELSON.

Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in court with Attorney Stephen Sargent on behalf of Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 15CT993. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Officer R. Wallis. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Arraignment scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.

Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dyrane Jerald Stanford not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/27/22 @ 2p
